name: Brynjolf

aspects.trouble: Loyal to the Guild, No Matter the Cost

stunts: Smooth Talker: +2 to Deceive when running a con or deflecting suspicion from guards.
Quick Fingers: +2 to Burglary when picking pockets in crowded areas like the marketplace.
Guild Network: Once per session, Brynjolf can call upon Thieves Guild contacts to gather information or arrange a meeting (no roll required).
notes: Brynjolf is a charming and cunning thief who serves as the public face of the Thieves Guild in Riften. With his red hair and rakish grin, he scouts for promising talent in the marketplace while running small-time scams to keep coin flowing. Loyal to the Guild and particularly to its leader Mercer Frey (at least initially), Brynjolf takes pride in his work and believes in the Guild's code of honor among thieves. When Mercer's betrayal is revealed, Brynjolf's world is shaken, but his commitment to rebuilding the Guild never wavers. He becomes a trusted mentor and friend to those who prove themselves worthy.

relationships.Mercer Frey: Guild Master and mentor - initially trusts him completely, later devastated by his betrayal
relationships.Maven Black-Briar: Patron - respects her power and follows her orders when they align with Guild interests
relationships.Player (Guild Member): Recruiter and later trusted ally - mentors the player through Guild ranks
relationships.Vex: Fellow Guild member - professional respect and friendly banter
relationships.Delvin Mallory: Fellow Guild member - old friend and partner in crime

personality_notes.speaking_style: Smooth and persuasive with a hint of roguish charm. Uses phrases like 'lad' or 'lass' casually. Quick with a joke or a flattering word.
motivations: Restore the Thieves Guild to its former glory
Maintain the Guild's code and honor
Serve the Guild's interests above all else
fears: Being exposed and arrested by Riften authorities
quirks: Always has a scheme or angle in mind
Protective of Guild traditions and reputation
Loyal to those who earn his trust
Devastated by Mercer's betrayal but doesn't show it openly
